TRANSACTION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FACILITY AT A GLANCE

I.  THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FACILITY 
 
A.  Justification 
 
1.  The transaction technical assistance (TA) facility will provide preparation support to four 
ensuing projects in the People’s Republic of China (PRC): (i) Guangxi Wuzhou Healthy City 
Development Program; (ii) Jilin Songhua Lake Ecological and Environmental Improvement; 
(iii) Shaanxi Xi’an Preschool Education Quality Improvement; and (iv) Shandong Jining Water 
Supply and Drainage Integration. The ensuing projects will be investments in urban services, 
green infrastructure, environmental improvement, and human capital development; these are well 
aligned  with  operational  and  strategic  priorities  of  both  the  government  and  the  Asian 
Development Bank (ADB).1 The ensuing projects, all in the urban and social sectors, will require 
a similar set of safeguards, financial management, and economic assessments. This transaction 
TA facility is listed in ADB’s country operations business plan for the PRC, 2019–2021.2  
 
2.  A strong track record of economic growth and poverty reduction has significantly improved 
quality of life in the PRC, but considerable economic, social, environmental, and institutional 
challenges  pose  obstacles  to  further  inclusive  and  sustainable  development.  ADB  support 
combines finance, knowledge, and partnerships to maximize development impact. In the PRC, 
ADB promotes innovative demonstration projects, knowledge sharing, institutional reform efforts, 
and private sector participation. The government looks to ADB to introduce innovative approaches, 
technology, and policies. Local governments prepare initial project proposals with the support of 
design institutes, but current country systems still need support for economic and financial due 
diligence—especially economic analysis and financial management assessment—environment 
and social safeguards due diligence, and sector assessments including sector governance.3 
 
3.  Project preparation activities in the PRC include (i) reviewing the feasibility study reports 
prepared by design institutes; (ii) conducting economic and financial due diligence and assessing 
procurement capacity; (iii) undertaking safeguards due diligence; (iv) analyzing poverty, social, 
and gender issues; and (v) preparing standard ADB documents and other requirements. Domestic 
capacity in engineering design is of a high standard so ADB-financed project preparation activities 
will not duplicate such efforts. With the aim of increasing efficiency, preparing projects faster, 
improving  project  readiness,  and  strengthening  responsiveness  to  government  priorities, 
transaction TA facilities allow ADB to engage experts to work on multiple projects. The TA facility 
will also support exploration of innovative financing modalities and approaches, including results-
based lending, during the development of the ensuing projects. 
 
4.  The ensuing projects. The proposed ensuing projects are aligned with ADB’s country 
partnership strategy for the PRC, 2016–2020 and several of ADB Strategy 2030 operational 
priorities:  addressing  remaining  poverty  and  reducing  inequalities;  accelerating  progress  in 
gender equality; tackling climate change, building climate and disaster resilience, and enhancing 
environmental sustainability; and making cities more livable (footnote 1). All ensuing projects will 
strive for the effective gender mainstreaming category or higher. The TA facility is classified as

5.  Guangxi Wuzhou Healthy City Development Program. The proposed results-based 
lending (RBL) program will transform Wuzhou in the Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region into 
an integrated and inclusive city. The program will reflect Strategy 2030’s emphasis on cross-
sectoral support to address complex development challenges and will adopt the healthy city 
approach anchored in the Healthy China 2030 plan.4 It will support (i) clean urban environment 
and infrastructure, (ii) improved quality of health services for urban residents including the elderly, 
(iii) health sector human resource development, (iv) healthy lifestyles, and (v) stronger and more 
integrated  urban  planning  and  governance.  Digital  technology  will  be  introduced  for  city 
management and social services. The program is expected to have a strong demonstration effect 
both within the PRC and in the region. The risk category is low because the loan amount does 
not exceed $200 million and safeguard categorization is other than A.  
 
6.  Jilin Songhua Lake Integrated Ecological and Environmental Improvement. The 
proposed project will improve ecological and environmental protection and management in 
Songhua Lake Area in Jilin City. This will be achieved through an integrated approach to (i) restore 
and protect the ecology in Songhua Lake and 12 rivers running into the lake; (ii) comprehensively 
manage pollution sources in towns and villages in the Songhua Lake Area through investment in 
wastewater, sanitation, and domestic and agriculture solid waste management infrastructure and 
services; (iii) control agriculture nonpoint source pollution in Songhua Lake Area by introducing 
cultivation modality with stronger soil stabilization capacity, reduced use of farm chemicals, and 
higher production value; and (iv) improve rural livelihood through business development service 
linked with environment protection. The project will also strengthen the city government’s capacity 
in environmental management with innovations such as comprehensive environmental monitoring 
and management system in Songhua Lake Area and researches supporting future environmental 
and ecological protection plan for Songhua Lake. The risk category is complex because safeguard 
categorization for environment is expected to be A.  
 
7.  Shaanxi  Xi’an  Preschool  Education  Quality  Improvement.  To  strengthen  human 
capital, the proposed RBL program will increase access to high quality and inclusive early 
childhood education (ECE) by constructing new kindergartens, upgrading existing ones, and 
creating an enabling environment for the recruitment and retention of teachers in Xi’an City. It will 
(i) construct, upgrade, and equip modern and inclusive kindergarten facilities; (ii) build capacity 
through  pre-  and  in-service  kindergarten teacher  training  using  innovative  methods  and  in 
partnership with local teacher training universities; and (iii) support research and pilot activities to 
inform and strengthen ECE in the PRC and beyond, including information and communication 
technology platforms for early childhood learning. The program will be aligned with the ambitious

targets for ECE enrolment set by the National Plan for Medium- and Long-Term Education Reform 
and Development, 2010–2020.5 The risk categorization is low because the loan amount does not 
exceed $200 million and safeguard categorization is other than A. 
 
8.  Shandong Jining Water Supply and Drainage Integration. The proposed project will 
contribute  to  enhanced  livability  in  Jiaxiang  County  in  Jining  City,  Shandong  Province  by 
improving water supply and sanitation infrastructure and delivering sustainable services. The 
project will expand the water supply network and sewage collection and treatment systems, and 
introduce appropriate innovations. The project will ensure the safety of potable water, protect the 
rural environment, and promote rural vitalization. It will also include capacity building for project 
implementation and systems operations and maintenance. The risk categorization is complex 
because safeguard categorization for both environment and involuntary resettlement is expected 
to be A.

C.  Cost and Financing 
  
10.  The TA facility is estimated to cost $2,000,000, of which $1,800,000 will be financed on a 
grant  basis  by  ADB’s  Technical  Assistance  Special  Fund  (TASF-other  sources).  The  key 
expenditure items are listed in Appendix 1. The TA facility will explore opportunities for cofinancing 
for  each  ensuing  project.  The  government  will  provide  counterpart  support  in  the  form  of 
counterpart staff, office facilities, domestic transportation, government data and studies, and other 
in-kind contributions. ADB informed the government that approval of the TA facility does not 
commit ADB to finance any ensuing project. 
 
D.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
11.  The TA facility activities for an ensuing project will start only after ADB approves the project 
concept paper for the ensuing project.  
 
12.  ADB will administer the TA facility, working closely with PRC counterparts. The Urban and 
Social Sectors Division of ADB’s East Asia Department (EASS) will select, administer, and 
supervise the consultants and the outputs to be delivered for the ensuing projects, including final 
evaluation of consultants. Implementation arrangements are summarized in Table 3.

13.  ADB will engage consultants following the ADB Procurement Policy (2017, as amended 
from time to time) and the associated project administration instructions and/or staff instructions. 
EASS will recruit consulting firms and individual consultants based on the requirements of each 
ensuing project. The technical expertise and duration of engagement in Appendix 3 are indicative 
and will be finalized prior to approval of each project concept paper in consultation with the

5 
government.6  Firms will be engaged following the quality- and cost-based selection method with 
a quality-cost ratio of 90:10 using full or simplified technical proposal procedures. 
 
14.  Individual consultants will provide specialized technical inputs to fulfill ADB advance 
planning, sector work and due diligence requirements, and enhance project readiness. The 
individual consultants will be selected through the individual consultants selection method and/or 
the use of framework agreements. Output-based terms of reference will be considered, including 
time-based or lumpsum contracts. When the preparation of ensuing projects requires the same 
set of expertise, efficiency may be achieved by engaging the same consultants.  
 
II.  THE PRESIDENT'S DECISION 
 
15.  The President, acting under the authority delegated by the Board, has approved the 
provision of technical assistance not exceeding the equivalent of $1,800,000 on a grant basis to 
the People’s Republic of China for Preparing Urban and Social Development Projects, and hereby 
reports this action to the Board.
